meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Eric Elfman Robert Michaels Bruce Seymour Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #772.

td.p: Eric Elfman, a dialogue author from Los Angeles, California
Robert Michaels, an economist originally from Chicago, Illinois
Bruce Seymour, a writer from Piedmont, California (whose 3-day cash winnings total $39,989)

tr.td: ZOOLOGY
BRITISH TRIVIA
WEAPONS
ODD JOBS
ACRONYMS
ADVERTISING

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', 'On some chipmunks, the pouches found here can extend as far back as their shoulders')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: On some chipmunks, the pouches found here can extend as far back as their shoulders

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_J_2_1', 'clue_J_2_1_stuck', '[The end-of-round signal sounds.]
(Alex: We won\'t get a chance for those last few. It\'s interesting that the last three clues we had on the board were all at the top. Normally we leave material at the bottom of the board.)

tea

Robert
')

a quarter to 3:00

Robert
')
div.onmouseout:
toggle('clue_DJ_2_2', 'clue_DJ_2_2_stuck', 'According to 1st line, time you\'d hear the following being sung:

"We\'re drinking, my friend /
To the end /
Of a brief episode /
Make it one..."')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td:
According to 1st line, time you'd hear the following being sung:
"We're drinking, my friend /
To the end /
Of a brief episode /
Make it one..."

div.h3: Scores at the end of the Double Jeopardy! Round:

tr.td: Bruce
Robert
Eric

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Alex: [To Bruce] You\'re right there at the top of our list for big money winners, and you\'re coming back tomorrow to try and become a 5-time champion for an automatic berth in next year\'s Tournament of Champions. So good luck to you there.)
RobertWho are Dicke C. Dickens +
$6,400
BruceWho were V. Hugo and C. Dickens?
$5,500
(2 of) Victor Hugo (Les Misérables), Charles Dickens (The Mystery of Edwin Drood), & Mark Twain (Big River)')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '2 of the 3 19th c. authors on whose stories the last 3 Tony Award winning musicals were based')

tr.td: BROADWAY MUSICALS
2 of the 3 19th c. authors on whose stories the last 3 Tony Award winning musicals were based
Bruce
Robert
Eric
4-day champion: $54,989
2nd place: a week's trip for 2 to Bluebeard's Castle aboard Eastern Airlines + either the Jeopardy! boxed game or the computerized version
3rd place: the 12-volume, 20-million-word The Motion Picture Guide to more than 53,000 films + either the Jeopardy! boxed game or the computerized version
Bruce
Robert
Eric

15 R
(including 2 DDs),
2 W
(including 1 DD)

6 R,
3 W

The Jeopardy! game show and all elements thereof, including but not limited to copyright and trademark thereto, are the property of Jeopardy Productions, Inc. and are protected under law.
